p: Berberis species are rich in anthocyanins that can protect the pancreatic β-cells against oxidative stress through antioxidant properties, promote insulin release from the pancreatic β-cells, activate AMPK (5′-adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase), the main enzyme for enhancing glucose transport into skeletal muscles, and inhibit α-glucosidase in the small intestine; all of these are the recognized mechanisms of anthocyanins antidiabetic activity [ 193].
